description:
In this module, we will discover how environmental
problems have exceeded their boundary as an “issue
area” and have altered contemporary political
theorizing. This includes questions related to the roles
of the state, the borders of the moral community, and
matters of justice. We will trace the transformation of
liberal, republican, conservative, socialist, and feminist
political thought in the wake of environmental politics.
Finally, we will ask whether there is such a thing as a
distinctly “green” political theory.
title: Environmental Political Theory
prerequisite: Completed 80MCs, including 28MCs in PS, with a minimum CAP of 3.20 or be on the Honours track, and PS3274.
